jobPostingInfo.title: Group Supervisor of Travel Reservations
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

The Travel and Invoice Management Section is seeking a leader to serve as the Supervisor of the Travel Reservations Group.  This unique opportunity is part of the Controller and Financial Planning Office, which supports the exploration and innovation of the laboratory's missions by working with our colleagues and subcontractors to guarantee compliance to the Prime Contract and maintain the fiscal internal control environment and the financial integrity of the Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL).  The Office ensures that the finance, accounting, forecasting and budget policies and procedures of the laboratory are efficient, effective and compliant with relevant regulation so that JPL can "Dare Mighty Things Together."  We pride ourselves on providing innovative solutions to overcome business challenges facing JPL on a regular basis.  Our collaborative teaming approach ensures us a unique window into the amazing work accomplished at JPL.

As the Supervisor of the Travel Reservations Group, you will be an advocate for the Controller and Financial Planning Office’s Strategic Plan.  The Group Supervisor will develop a respected, agile and trusted team, promote continuous process improvement, and pilot the team to be a trusted business partner for the Lab.  The Group Supervisor will be responsible for leading a team in performing a varied range of Travel Reservations activities.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Lead, coach, develop, and provide direction to team members within the Travel Reservations Group.

  • Oversee day-to-day activities and make decisions/recommendations including hiring, promotions, performance appraisals and salary changes.

  • Establish team objectives and motivate team to use efficient approaches to meet those objectives.  Measure performance against said objectives.

  • Motivate team members to maximize performance and value across a variety of Travel Reservations activities including advising travelers on policy and procedure, booking travel reservations, ensuring compliance to travel policy.

  • Subject matter expert for the overall travel process and JPL travel policy.

  • Ensure understanding and compliance to JPL travel policy and procedures internally across team members and externally with customers.

  • Stay up to date on industry best practices and apply those practices where applicable with a focus on process improvement, compliance to travel policy and ensuring a positive experience for travelers.

  • Continuous review of JPL travel policy and procedures.

  • Build/strengthen relationships with JPL’s travel community while ensuring compliance to travel policy.

  • Negotiate with hotel properties to ensure favorable rates for JPL travelers.

  • Be an advocate for the Controller and Financial Planning Office’s Strategic Plan.

  • Support internal/external auditing projects as needed.  Coordinate collection of source documentation and review for accuracy before handing over to the auditors, develop audit responses, and handle any audit corrective actions.

  • Perform special assignments as directed.

Qualifications

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Business, or related discipline with a minimum of 9 years of related experience or Master's degree in similar disciplines with a minimum of 7 years of related experience or a PhD in similar disciplines with a minimum of 5 years of related experience. Two years of experience leading projects and/or teams.

  • Working knowledge of best practices across corporate travel reservations software and processes.

  • Operational background with Global Distribution Systems, preferably Galileo.  Understanding of the interfaces with the GDS, Concur and Oracle.

  • Working knowledge of call center operations.

  • Ability to forensically research travel itineraries for audit purposes.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.  Strong negotiation skills.

  • Excellent critical analysis, problem solving and strategic planning skills.

  • Ability to handle sensitive information.

  • Demonstrated ability to facilitate and/or work in a team environment and strong desire to manage in an organization dedicated to providing customer focused services.

  • Demonstrated experience effectively interacting with all levels of management.

  • Demonstrated experience in effectively leading cross-organizational teams and guiding team members to execute operational responsibilities.

  • Demonstrated ability to be adaptable, flexible, and resilient.

  • Demonstrated ability to manage a virtual team.

  • Ability to establish and meet deadlines while managing multiple priorities.

  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office tools including Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint.

Got These?  Even Better:

  • Understanding and experience with SAP Concur suite of products, especially Travel, Request, or Expense.

  • Working knowledge of government travel rules and regulations.

  • Working knowledge across a broad spectrum of finance and accounting disciplines to ensure value added cross functional solutions and transferrable knowledge for career growth into other areas.

  • Progressive Microsoft Excel data analysis experience including Pivot tables, VLOOKUP’s, macros, etc.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
